event_1.description:
Taking CS102 (Programming Fundamentals II), IS442 (Object Oriented Programming) in the upcoming semester? Are you looking for an introduction to Java programming to prepare you for the upcoming semester, or want to learn a new programming language?

Ellipsis is here to help with its annual Java Workshop!

The workshop is a crash course on Java Programming, from Java syntax and control flow to Object-Oriented Concepts such as encapsulation, abstraction and object inheritance.

event_2.event_name: Befriending Kamma: A Life Shaped By Choices
event_2.description:
The concept of Kamma, or Karma often evokes feelings of fear due to its association with a universal system of punishment and reward. However, when explored through the teachings of the Buddha, Kamma takes on a profound meaning—one that emphasizes the pivotal role of our intentions in shaping our destinies.

Contrary to common misconceptions, Kamma isn't a system of cosmic retribution; rather, it serves as a powerful reminder that our lives are influenced by the intentions behind our actions in body, speech and mind. There is no force of predetermined fate as our mindful choices have the transformative potential to reshape our lives.

Join us this Thursday as we explore this teaching and how we can break free from negative patterns in our lives.

event_3.event_name: Xplore workshop - Repurposing Materials Towards Zero Waste
event_3.description:
Discover the Art of Circular Fashion and Reduce Textile Waste!
Circularity can be integrated creatively and effectively into our daily lives. Join us for an experiential learning workshop where we will breathe new life into discarded fabrics and garments and reduce textile wastage. We welcome all individuals who are keen on reducing their environmental footprint and expanding their creative skillset towards sustainability. No prior sewing knowledge is required.
The 2.5 hour long Workshop includes a brief introduction on sustainable textiles and waste reduction, hand sewing and machine operation skills and allows participants sufficient hands-on time to create their individual product out of old materials.

event_4.description:
Sawasdee ka/krub ☺️
How is this year going so far? Does everyone have a great start in school for this new year or do you still miss the unforgettable moments from the last few years?

No fear! There is nothing a nice movie break cannot cure! 

Come and join if you love coming-of-age stories.

Dive into the memories of your teenage emotions and enjoy the retro mood of the movie that captures the charm of highschool first crush without any miss!

Bring your buddies and have a nostalgic movie night together!

Snacks and drinks are on us 🍿🥤

Feel free to bring your refreshments!

Registration is first-come, first-served basis.

Secure the spot by signing up here now ❣️

event_5.description:
SEIC is back with its introductory Economic Research and Writing Workshop!  

This workshop, led by SMU's Economics Research Librarian, Melody Chin, is designed to equip you with essential economic research and writing skills. 

It will cover key skills in navigating databases and publications for economic writing and will enhance your understanding of economic analysis and communication.

event_6.description:
Dear SMU Community,

We invite you to a fun-filled evening to kickstart the semester with us at the🎲✨ICS Games Night✨🎮

Grab your friends to sign up for an unforgettable experience filled with Indian snacks, thrilling games, and the chance to win incredible prizes!

🎉 What Awaits You? 🎉

🤝Network: Connect with fellow participants to expand your social network and create lasting memories!

🎊 Grand Prize: Join the exciting lucky draw for a chance to win Grab vouchers!

event_7.description:
Introducing Product Club’s First Agile Workshop! 📢

We have meticulously crafted this workshop to empower beginners with the technical skills essential for landing that coveted internship, and elevate your understanding of Agile methodologies in a real-world context while networking among like-minded individuals! ✨

🚀 We are thrilled to announce our distinguished guest, David Marsh—an Agile Coach from Wavestone with 20+ years of experience! 🧑‍🏫 Join us for an interactive session including activities and quizzes, followed by a live Q&A to delve deeper into the world of Agile! 🎤

This workshop will mainly touch on how we can use Agile to focus organisational efforts on customer needs 🎯, improve efficiency and reduce work in progress and waiting times ⏳ and adapt quickly in projects to solve complex problems 🔄

event_8.description:
‼️ ATTENTION, FUTURE LEADERS!‼️
Are you on the lookout for opportunities to elevate your professional journey? Eager to connect with accomplished Indonesian alumni?

SMU Komunitas Indonesia applauds you for being in the right place because SMUKI Connect 2024 is BACK and BETTER THAN EVER!

Seize the opportunity to:
⭐️ Engage in dynamic discussions with Indonesian alumni and connect with our distinguished speakers, including:
- Surya Gunawan Ali (Consulting Manager at TalearnX)
- Stephanie Kurniawan (Associate Consultant at Hakuhodo Consulting)
- Hardyanto Putra Antony K. (Cloud Solution Architect at Huawei Cloud)
🔥 Gain exclusive, invaluable insights into their success stories during our vibrant networking session!

👋 Tap into your greatness – Free sign-ups for all SMU students! Dinner will be provided.

event_9.description:
Are you feeling the need for an urgent tax recap? Have you always been intrigued by matters relating to tax and do you possess a burning desire to explore further? Or perhaps you are craving for bite-sized tax concepts from the professionals? 

Well, we have good news for you! SMU Tax Society proudly presents our second installment of TAX BITES, an introductory workshop covering the fundamentals of tax including Personal Income Tax, Corporate Tax, and GST. This year, we are honored to have industry speakers from Deloitte, IRAS and KPMG to share and delve into these 3 core concepts. Our tax primer is aimed at equipping students with foundational and relevant tax concepts, and the roles that taxes play in our lives and in society – a good refresher for students looking for a career in the tax sector! 

Students from all schools are welcome! Through this session, you will learn about:   

·         Essential tax laws and practices in Singapore 

·         Tax planning techniques 

·         Personal tax concepts (including personal reliefs and rebates) 

·         Type of taxable income streams 

·         The purpose and basic concepts of Goods and Services Tax (GST)

event_10.description:
✨ Embark on a Culinary Journey and Cultural Adventure! ✨

Indulge in a feast of authentic Middle Eastern cuisines meticulously crafted to transport you to the heart of the region. 🗺️୨୧˚ From mouthwatering hummus to delectable falafels, experience the true essence of Middle Eastern culture! ૮₍ ˃ ⤙ ˂ ₎ა

Not only that, discover the beauty of community and connection as we play fun games 🎲and share not just meals 🍽️ but stories and laughter 🗣

event_11.description:
Feeling overwhelmed with schoolwork? 😖

Take a break and join us for a vibrant karaoke session with songs from the recent Yoasobi concert!

If singing isn’t your vibe, we have prepared a timeless Japanese film 君の名は (Your Name) for you to relieve stress 😌

event_12.description:
ou have heard of RESTful API. But have you thought of communication options beyond REST?

Dive into the world of gRPC and WebSockets, crucial for modern development! Build your expertise and satisfy your curiosity by joining us! Tailored for web development enthusiasts, ITSA and ESD students, this session offers both theory and hands-on experience. RESTless no more, let’s go beyond REST!

WHAT TO EXPECT
- Learn about efficient, real-time communication in a tech-driven landscape
- Explore gRPC
- Understand persistent connections via WebSockets.

We will be exploring various programming languages such as Python and JavaScript. Knowledge of at least one programming language and have done web development is advised.

event_13.description:
🌅 ⛰ Hike along Dairy Farm Nature Park and Bukit Timah with us before Recess week ends! 

This Saturday, let’s explore Singapore’s nature till the cows come home (or until 12pm)! 🐮🌳

event_14.description:
Join us for an exclusive tour into the heart of innovation at PSA's cutting-edge Innovation Centre in Singapore! PSA Innovation Centre is an experiential, multimedia showcase of PSA’s next-generation port and wider supply chain ecosystem. Delve into the world's largest transhipment hub, operated by PSA Corporation.

Join us to:
- Uncover exciting career/internship opportunities. 
- Engage with captivating interactive exhibits and discover the ground-breaking advancements driving PSA's operations. 
- Network with PSA's Cybersecurity team to find out how the team safeguards critical infrastructure. 

Don't miss out on this unique opportunity! Refreshments will be provided.

event_15.description:
Curious about venturing into the dynamic realms of Commodities or Maritime industries, yet uncertain about the pathways or opportunities they offer?

Join us to delve deeper into the world of Commodity Trading, Port Operations, Chartering, Digitalisation, Sustainable Fuels and much more at SMU Maritime Merchants Society Industry Networking Night! Seize this chance to gain valuable insights and connect with industry experts! 🌍

event_16.description:
📽️🍿 Celebrate the end of finals with a free movie screening! 🍿📽️

Just one more week till finals are over! Call your friends and join us on the last day of finals to watch “Your Eyes Tell”, an award-winning Japanese film that will pull at your heartstrings! 🎥 

Released in 2020, “Your Eyes Tell” is not your stereotypical romance trope. The film follows the story of Rui, a once-promising kickboxer, and Akari, a girl who lost her eyesight and family in a tragic car accident. 
Touching on love, disability, acceptance and personal growth, “Your Eyes Tell” will bring you on a journey that leaves a lasting impression on your heart. 💜

Join us and enjoy unlimited freshly made popcorn, assorted desserts (Brownies, Eclairs and Cream Puffs) and drinks! You also stand a chance in winning some delicious Bizlink Enterprise Cornflake Cookies when you participate in our activity booths before the movie starts! 🍪

event_17.description: SMU SoundFoundry proudly presents our Annual Production: The Red Gala ✨This lavish night of grandeur will feature SoundFoundry’s very own bands playing music ranging from pop to rock, and even their own originals!🔥✨To add light to the flame, local artists Daniel Sid and Bellied Star will be making a special appearance as our headliner acts!! 🤩❤️‍🔥🤯So, what are you waiting for? Join us for a night of fantastic music and company now!!

event_18.description:
Guitarissimo is back with another round of our Summer Beginner Guitar Classes! 🎉 
Join our 5-session course and emerge as a master of basic chord progressions and strumming patterns! ✨🎊
Our classes will cover popular English songs such as Drivers License, Yellow, Love Story, Until I Found You and more! It is also 100% beginner friendly, including the provision of guitars and take-home music sheets during the sessions! 😳🥳
Here are the details:
Dates (5 sessions): 4 May, 11 May, 18 May, 25 May, 1 June 
Time: Saturdays, 4 pm - 6 pm
Venue: LKCSB Basement Studio
Price: $65 (for 5 sessions)



An exciting and enriching experience awaits you!✨🫵🏼

event_21.description:
After collaborating with other clubs in the past for Songkran, we're thrilled to announce that SMUMC is hosting its very first solo Water Festival at Sentosa Beach. Come join us in celebrating the Burmese New Year! 🎉
This marks a significant milestone for our club, and we couldn't be more excited to celebrate with all of you. 
With the sun, sand, and sea as our backdrop, this is bound to be an unforgettable day filled with laughter, friendship, and summer vibes. 🤩🌊🐚

We have very limited spots so gather your friends and sign-up now to secure your spots!

event_22.event_name: SMU SOE Seminar Series: The Skyscraper Revolution
event_22.description: Tall buildings are central to facilitating sustainable urbanization and growth in cities worldwide. We estimate average elasticities of city population and built area to aggregate city building heights of 0.12 and-0.17, respectively, indicating that the largest global cities in developing economies would be at least one-third smaller on average without their tall buildings. Land saved from urban development by post-1975 tall building construction is over 80% covered in vegetation. To isolate the effects of technology-induced reductions in the cost of height from correlated demand shocks, we use interactions between static demand factors and the geography of bedrock as instruments for observed 1975-2015 tall building construction in 12,877 cities worldwide, a triple difference identification strategy. Quantification using a canonical urban model suggests that the technology to build tall generates a potential global welfare gain of 4.8%, of which only about one-quarter has been realized. Estimated welfare gains from relaxing existing height constraints are 5.9% in the developed world and 3.1% in developing economies.

event_23.description: Curious about Islam? Ever wondered what Islam is all about? Well, this is your chance to find out! 🙌 SMU Muslim Society (SMUMS) and Converts Central (CC) present "Understanding Islam!" 🌟 Join us for a four-session seminar that challenges myths and misconceptions about the fastest-growing religion in the world. 🌍 Dive deep into the core tenets of Islam and discover the truth beyond the stereotypes. 🔍Everyone is welcome to engage in constructive dialogue and help bridge cultural divides. Don't miss out on this opportunity to broaden your perspective and ask any questions you may have about Islam! 💬

event_24.event_name: Mother's Day Special: Flower Arrangement Workshop (❁ᴗ͈ˬᴗ͈)
event_24.description: ੈ♡˳ Still missing that special something to gift your mom this upcoming Mother’s day? ◌༉‧ Surprise her with an alluring bouquet of fresh blooms ✨  from our collection of flowers 🌷, specially assembled and curated by you! Make this Mother’s day a truly unforgettable one with us! ⭐💖୨୧ Don't say a little birdie didn't tell you... 🕊

Whether you're a seasoned dancer or taking your first steps onto the dance floor, our classes cater to all levels! 🫶🏻

Date: 11 May, Saturday
Time: 9am to 12pm
Location: Singapore Canoe Federation - Kallang
Price: $14
Promotion: 2 pax for $25!!
😎 Sign up HERE! We can't wait to see you at our paddles! 😎
✨No kayaking experience required✨ 
🏊 Students without recognised swim certificates are required to clear a water proficiency test (WPT) before the event. 🏊

event_27.description: 🏄 SMUX XSeed’s Cable Ski Session 💦☀️Hot day? 🥵 No better way to cool off than enjoying a splashing good time cable skiing on 11 May 2024! 🤩💦 No experience is required, and equipment will be provided!You need to have cleared WPT or have the relevant swim certificates to join us this session. Looking forward to seeing you there! 😊

✨🛹 SMUX XSeed’s Regular Longboarding Session 🛹✨ What better way to kick off summer by learning a new skill? Come down and pick up longboarding with us at the National Stadium on Friday, 17 May! No experience is required and longboarding equipment will be provided!
So what are you waiting for??

event_29.event_name: 🎶 TIMELESS: NONSENSE II: Where Dance & Bingo Collide 🎶
event_29.description: Dive into an evening where every dance move unlocks a world of possibilities, and every bingo number could redefine your experience. At TIMELESS: NONSENSE II, we crafted an event where the thrill of dance meets the playful suspense of bingo. A production where nobody, not the audience nor the dancers, know what is in store for them, with every item being decided LIVE through bingo games! Be part of TIMELESS: NONSENSE II – an experience that promises not just to entertain, but to redefine entertainment.

event_30.description: Get an exclusive guided tour and chat with the Speaker of Parliament, Mr Seah Kian Peng!

event_31.description: Don't bojio, you know you've been waiting for—🛼THE HIROLLER EXPERIENCE🛼🪩Nostalgic for the roller rinks of the 80s that you've never gotten to experience? Now's your chance to do so at HiRoller's electrifying retro roller rink.⚡Don’t miss this opportunity to get a COMPLIMENTARY NAME TENT and stand a chance to win a pair of FLYING EAGLE F5S SKATES!!🤩 You get 1 additional chance in our lucky draw for Flying Eagle F5S skates for EACH HiRoller / Skate Experience session you sign up for → so what are you waiting for?

event_32.description:
Looking for a way to spend your summer break and learn something new? Look no further as SMU Tennis presents Pickleball Clinic! 🤸🏻‍♂️Come join us and try this up-and-coming sport with your friends! You will learn the basics of the sport, which combines elements of Tennis 🎾, Badminton 🏸, and Table Tennis 🏓, 
as well as play some friendly matches.

event_33.venue: East Coast Park Cleanpod (near Carpark F2)
event_33.description: 🤿 In collaboration with Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) Scuba Team! 👀 🧩Looking for a fun summer activity? As part of our conservation efforts, join us as we find Sea Glass and pick up litter along the beaches at East Coast Park! Create beautiful and sustainable pieces of jewellery which you can take home! 💚 Feel free to stay after too and get to know like-minded individuals from SIT! Grab a friend and join us for a meaningful and fun time 🏝️🌴🕶️

event_34.description: Calling all adrenaline seekers and floorball enthusiasts!🏒 Get ready to experience the ultimate thrill on court as we bring you the most electrifying floorball event of the year. Lace up your sneakers, grab your sticks and join us for an action-packed day filled with speed, skills, and sheer excitement.✨ Whether you’re a seasoned player or a newcomer to the sport, this event promises to deliver heart pounding matches, jaw dropping goals and a vibrant atmosphere like no other!

event_35.description: Join SMU Chamber Choir for our annual production Wrinkles in The Air XV on 15 June 2024 at Chamber, The Arts House, as we serenade you with songs about this crazy desire. What is this crazy desire? Love. We sing of this crazy desire—este deseo loco—in Stroope’s Four Spanish Sonnets, until we believe, perhaps as de la Vega may have, that love trumps everything.  Love was Shakespeare’s language; and we sing his language in Dobrogosz’ My Rose songs and Harris’ Sonnet, an effusive ode to the Bard. The modal harmonies and whole tone melodies create a tonal flux that bewitches and bewilders the ear, a restless love. To act or not to act on this crazy desire, ask the Three Flower Songs of Whitacre, and our final act is a telling of Bernstein’s West Side Story—the Ultimate Love Story, the story of ‘til death do us part—of a Romeo after every Juliet’s heart. Let love take centre stage, where every note sings of wild desires and timeless tales!

event_36.description:
Knockout advice for knockout careers.

At B.I.G, we focus on your overall growth beyond boxing.

Unsure about your career path? Join us to hear from members and alumni about their diverse internship experiences.

Join Us for the Ultimate Boxing Clinic! 

Whether you're a seasoned boxer or just curious to dip your toes into the ring, this event is for YOU!

What to Expect:
 • Boxing drills
 • Hands-on workshop
 • Lucky draw, fun bonding games, and more!

Why Attend?
 • Discover the exhilarating world of boxing
 • Connect with fellow boxing enthusiasts
 • Perfect opportunity for beginners to get started
 • Make new friends in SMU!

event_38.description:
Gain valuable insights and tips for completing your Project Experience (Final Year Project)! Join us for informative sharing and a Q&A session with our SCIS Professors, tailored to each SCIS major.
Take your first step in acing your Project Experience!

event_39.description:
Starting off in University can feel like navigating a new operating system, but SMUPS has got your back. 

We have some outstanding seniors who are excited to share their insights on revision techniques, internship opportunities, module bidding, and more during our Q&A session! 

We'll wrap up with a casual networking session, giving you the chance to connect with your peers and seniors like never before. Don't miss this opportunity to upgrade your university experience!

event_40.description:
Elevate your networking experience by engaging in meaningful, small-group conversations with industry professionals and alumni. 

Engage in deeper conversations, gain practical insights from experts, and learn from the experiences of those who’ve walked the path before you. Don’t miss this opportunity to expand your knowledge and network!

event_41.description:
Kickstart the New Semester with Connect China 'Welcome Tea' Event! 

Are you wondering where to meet new friends? Do you love games and crave exciting prizes? Or maybe you think your SMU lanyard could use a fun upgrade? If you answered "yes" to any of these questions, then our Welcome Tea event is perfect for you!

Join us in celebrating the joy of making new connections and indulging in some serious fun as you start your journey at SMU this new semester! We can't wait to welcome you and create unforgettable memories together!

event_42.description:
Are you curious about how this mentorship programme will be run? Are you wondering what you will gain from this Sports Exercise & Performance Psychology Mentorship programme that is the first of its kind? Come down for this exciting sharing session to find out more!

Join like-minded psychology students like yourself for an evening of learning about the SEP field as well, with renowned psychologist Edgar K Tham and his team from SportsPsych Consulting sharing about their services — from mental toughness training to performance enhancement training.

Are you Y1? 2? 3? 4? It doesn’t matter! This mentorship program is open to everyone, regardless of their year! Don’t miss this opportunity to grow both personally and professionally!

event_43.description: Join us for an insightful journey into the world of the Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX), Singapore's pioneering statutory board dedicated to developing advanced science and technology capabilities for homeland security.

We'll also be inviting therapy dogs down to SMU, for you to experience these positive feelings yourself!

Gear up for a fun afternoon! ⚙️

This week’s featured games are Mario Party and Pokken Tournament! 

Feel free to come play other games too!

Gather your friends and have a fun afternoon with us! See you soon!

event_46.description:
Immerse yourself in a world of fluid creativity at our Acrylic Pour Art Jam session!  

Let your imagination flow as you mix vibrant colors with secret and unique techniques to create mesmerizing, one-of-a-kind abstract masterpieces. 

Let’s bring your art to life with every pour!

event_48.description:
Feeling a little lost about what tracks or majors to pursue? Uncertain about which academic pathway to take? Well fret not, as OIKOS proudly presents Mapping Your Major (MYM) 2024, to help students learn about the various tracks and majors offered by the School of Economics and other majors commonly pursued by Economics undergraduates! 

Look forward to hearing from professors and alumni about their experiences, careers and prospects through our rotating fireside chat.

event_49.description:
T.R.A.S.H.G.O~ you can take that trash to go! Let's do our part in keeping our Kallang waters rubbish free !! After all, aren't water activities best enjoyed when the water is clean? 

Trash doesn't spark joy!! So... let's take them out‼️‼️

event_50.description: Let us take you on a trip through taste, travelling across Asia as we craft distinctly delectable Asian flavours from Malaysia, Japan and Singapore.
